articles.description: Listen to BBC Radio 5 Live commentary as Manchester United face Fulham and follow live text from three other games in the Premier League, followed by Bournemouth facing Manchester City and Arsenal against Newcastle.
articles.title: Premier League: Build-up to six games with Man Utd, Man City & Arsenal in action

articles.description: Relive all the action as Wigan Warriors beat Penrith Panthers to win a record-equalling World Club Challenge title.
articles.title: World Club Challenge: Wigan edge Penrith in thrilling contest - as it happened

articles.description: Arsenal underline their Premier League title credentials as they record their sixth consecutive win with a dominant display against Newcastle.
articles.title: Arsenal thrash Newcastle to underline title credentials

articles.description: Manchester City move a point behind Premier League leaders Liverpool with a hard-fought victory over Bournemouth at Vitality Stadium.
articles.title: Man City beat Bournemouth to close in on Liverpool

articles.description: Wigan win a dramatic World Club Challenge against Penrith Panthers after being on the right end of two key video reviews.
articles.title: World Club Challenge: Wigan Warriors 16-12 Penrith Panthers - Cherry and Whites crowned world champions for fifth time

articles.description: Duhan van der Merwe becomes the first Scotland player to score a Calcutta Cup hat-trick as the hosts rack up a fourth successive Six Nations victory over England at Murrayfield.
articles.title: Van der Merwe hat-trick sinks England at Murrayfield

articles.description: Harry Kane scores a stoppage-time winner as Bayern Munich beat RB Leipzig to pick up an important win in the Bundesliga title race.
articles.title: Kane hits stoppage-time winner as Bayern beat Leipzig

articles.description: Ireland head coach Andy Farrell praises his side's "resilience" and "tenacity" after overcoming Wales to stay on course for a second straight Grand Slam.
articles.title: 'Ireland show resilience to keep Slam in sight'

articles.description: Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag insists the future is positive for the Old Trafford club despite losing at home to Fulham for only the second time in 61 years.
articles.title: 'Bigger picture very good' - Ten Hag remains upbeat

articles.description: Barcelona thrash mid-table Getafe to move up to the second spot in La Liga.
articles.title: Barcelona thrash Getafe to go second in La Liga
